channel.title: Brand Specific Game Integrations on Aurora User Docs
channel.description: Recent content in Brand Specific Game Integrations on Aurora User Docs

item.title: Brand Integrations
item.description:
Some of the brand specific game integrations are reverse-engineered to work with Aurora. See their pages to see how they are configured.

Game Integrations Aurora Supports

  • Chroma
  • Lightsync
  • LightFX

PCGamingWiki page about integrations

item.title: Alienware LightFX
item.description:
You can use Lightsync integration with all supported devices using Aurora

You must install LightFX wrapper dll to the game directory from Aurora settings.

Note that this is reverse engineered and may not work as the original.

In case game integration doesn’t work, use LightFX Sample Application to test if the integration is working properly.

item.title: Logitech Lightsync
item.description:
You can use Lightsync integration with all supported devices using Aurora

Note that this is reverse engineered and may not work as the original.

You can have LGS installed and Aurora will automatically apply game effects to your devices.

LGS must be fully closed before Aurora is launched.

In case a specific game integration doesn’t work, use Lightsync Sample Application to test if the integration is working properly.

item.title: Razer Chroma
item.description:
You can use Chroma integration with all supported devices using Aurora

Note that this is reverse engineered and may not work as the original.

You can have Synapse installed and Aurora will automatically apply game effects to your devices. Then, “Razer Chroma SDK Service” needs to be running for the integration to work.

Chrome Enabled Games List on www.razer.com

In case game integration doesn’t work, use Chroma Sample Application to test if the integration is working properly.
